articles.title: Lionel Messi: Argentina icon's meeting with fans on the road goes viral
articles.description: Messi is back in Argentina for the international break
articles.content:
Lionel Messi is the most popular man in Argentina these days.
That wasn't the case for quite some time, particularly after he retired from international duty following the nation's defeat to Chile in the 2016 Copa America final.

articles.title: Argentina National Team to Play River Plate Friendly
articles.description: The informal fixture was arranged following an invitation to participate in River’s training and will be part of a national celebration for the world champions as they reunite on Argentine soil
articles.content:
Argentina have agreed to play a friendly against River Plate on Friday, following their first game since their World Cup triumph when they host Panama at the Monumental stadium in Buenos Aires on Thursday.

articles.title: Connacht announce signing of Argentina winger Santiago Cordero
articles.description: The exciting winger will join the Sportsground from French side Bordeaux Begles, where he has scored 29 tries in 67 appearances.
articles.content:
Connacht rugby have announced the signing of Argentina winger Santiago Cordero on a two-year-contract.

articles.title: Connacht sign Pumas wing Cordero
articles.description: Connacht have announced the signing of Argentina winger Santiago Cordero from Bordeaux-Begles.
articles.content:
Connacht have announced the signing of Argentina winger Santiago Cordero from Bordeaux-Begles.
Cordero, who has scored 12 tries in 45 Tests for Los Pumas, has signed a two-year contract at the Sportsground, beginning from the start of next season.

articles.title: JetSMART Peru Requests 21 Additional International Routes
articles.description: The airline is looking to fly to Argentina, Brazil, Chile, the Dominican Republic, Ecuador, Paraguay, and Uruguay.
articles.content:
Ultra-low-cost carrier JetSMART Peru has filed a request to operate 21 new international routes to 17 destinations across Seven South American countries, mainly in Brazil.
